reviewText: Be the worlds best Driver"
date: the store page says.  If being the best driver means driving on an ice skating rink
recommended: the cars are all so floaty the slightest movement causes the cars to careen off screen or into walls.  From the start of the game it shows there is zero AI at all in the other computer drivers.  Facing a straight road you have to hit speed jumps to go faster.  Right away all the other cars speed away at the speed of light making it impossible to win.  The AI opponents it seems are set to challenge the racer as if they have all upgrades already which is impossible on the first track.  The game has a bunch of tracks but who cares if their impossible to unlock since you need 1st place in the first 3 stages to unlock the next set.  Basically for the price you get 3 races thats it.\n\nThese should be the little cars they sell in stores
hoursPlayed: instead of feeling like their little they just feel like regular cars with really bad controls.  There is no super small driving fun in a world where everything is bigger.  There isnt much selection of cars seems for each team there is 2 cars
voteText: there seems to be unlockable cars but it doesnt say how to unlock them and who cares since this sucks.  The announcer is the most robotic generic voice in history
helpfulPercent: its not fun it feels like someone is using a text to speech device to teach the player how to drive
votesHelpful:
that isnt fun!!! Games should be FUN!!!!

Get Super Toy Cars for super fun small racing:  http://store.steampowered.com/app/116100/

reviewText:
Where has this game(tm) been all my life(tm)?

This marks the first time in *years* that I've come across a game that's MST3K-tier bad. If I hadn't bought this from Greenman on uber-clearance, I'd be crying an entirely different sort of tears right now. I laughed so hard, I developed abs.

One complaint, though; I wish there was a way to tweak the controls to be slightly more absurdly sensitive.  I feel like I'm not flying off the track enough.

reviewText:
Terrible. Everything you'd never think of when you think of Hot Wheels. I especially like the events where you drive slowly up a hill collecting green tokens.,

I wish I'd been at the meeting where they decided what would go into this game, so I could throw things at whatever idiots thought that whatever this is was a good idea.

It's like someone had the most awesome racing game opportunity and decided to try and do it without any racing. Then they had the most awesome stunt game opportunity and decided to do it without any stunts. This is what was left over.

reviewText: Well then. I suppose it's no surprise that this isn't exactly Burnout Paradise 2.\n\nOn a scale of Driveclub to 10, I'd give this about a 2. The graphics are fine, but everything else is awful.

reviewText: Don't buy this game! It's completely hopeless on a computer. The controls are all set for an xbox controller with no way of changing them and if you try finding them you'll see that they are in the most random places. reviewText:
I haven't played a game this awful in a LONG time.

The controls don't work, there is NO RACING in this game, they all drive horribly. If you wish to play with a gamepad y ou will be switching back and forth from controller to mouse quite often. Graphics are lack luster.

reviewText:
so, this game
its pretty OK. and by that i means that the large amounts of OK'S make it not OK
ok?
-the controls are a bit on the down side(why am i not suprised its controller oriented?)
-the gameplay is lackluster, a bit boring really
-i can run it at 30FPS on medium (Not a bad thing, but its an achievement to my craptop)
-GAMEPLAY GIMICS HOORAY!
-theres a kinda open world aspect, i mean theres a hub but it isnt all that big when you start out
-its got Sonic'06 styled momentum (PPHHT Screw gravity, b!tch im a car)
-appearent all the cars have ice wheels, super slippery
-gotta go a max speed of 100 MPH

its pretty OK, if you want it *that* badly wait for a sale, i bought it for $5 and it seemed worth the price, definently not worth $20 though
